page.title: 07CHANGING TIMES
page.content: Mr.R.Glynn Griffith is a deacon at my chapel and is 87years old.He was a tailor and his father's firm employed 12 tailors at one time.When he was young many ships were moored at Deganwy,bringing in timber from Scandinavia,and taking Ffestiniog roofing slates to other parts of the world.Pleasure craft are the only vessels to be seen today.Deganwy has grown in size since Mr Griffith's boyhood as he remembers playing football in the fields where the houses on the LLandudno side of Deganwy are today.He remembers Dafydd Gloi who drove a horse drawn bus carrying visitors between LLandudno and Conwy.Today people travel by train,bus or private car.
